Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-403 Collection, remittance, and payment of nursing care facilities assessment.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-403(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-403(1)(a): An assessment is imposed upon each nursing care facility in the amount designated in Subsection (1)(c).
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-403(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-403(1)(b)(i): The department shall establish by rule, a uniform rate per non-Medicare patient day that may not exceed 6% of the total gross revenue for services provided to patients of all nursing care facilities licensed in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-403(1)(b)(ii): For purposes of Subsection (1)(b)(i), total revenue does not include charitable contribution received by a nursing care facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-403(1)(c): The department shall calculate the assessment imposed under Subsection (1)(a) by multiplying the total number of patient days of care provided to non-Medicare patients by the nursing care facility, as provided to the department pursuant to Subsection (3)(a), by the uniform rate established by the department pursuant to Subsection (1)(b).
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-403(2): 26B-1-332
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-403(2)(a): The assessment imposed by this part is due and payable on a monthly basis on or before the last day of the month next succeeding each monthly period.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-403(2)(b): The collecting agent for this assessment shall be the department which is vested with the administration and enforcement of this part, including the right to audit records of a nursing care facility related to patient days of care for the facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-403(2)(c): 26B-1-332 The department shall forward proceeds from the assessment imposed by this part to the state treasurer for deposit in the expendable special revenue fund as specified in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-403(3): Each nursing care facility shall, on or before the end of the month next succeeding each calendar monthly period, file with the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-403(3)(a): a report which includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-403(3)(a)(i): the total number of patient days of care the facility provided to non-Medicare patients during the preceding month;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-403(3)(a)(ii): the total gross revenue the facility earned as compensation for services provided to patients during the preceding month; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-403(3)(a)(iii): any other information required by the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-403(3)(b): a return for the monthly period, and shall remit with the return the assessment required by this part to be paid for the period covered by the return.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-403(4): Each return shall contain information and be in the form the department prescribes by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-403(5): The assessment as computed in the return is an allowable cost for Medicaid reimbursement purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-403(6): The department may by rule, extend the time for making returns and paying the assessment.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-403(7): 26B-3-404 Each nursing care facility that fails to pay any assessment required to be paid to the state, within the time required by this part, or that fails to file a return as required by this part, shall pay, in addition to the assessment, penalties as provided in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-404 Penalties .
-------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-404(1): The division shall require a nursing care facility that fails to pay an assessment due under this part to pay to the division, in addition to the assessment, a penalty determined by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-404(2): The department may waive the imposition of a penalty for good cause.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-404(3): The division shall make rules in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, prescribing the administration and requirements for this section.

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-502 Application.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-502(1): Other than for the imposition of the assessment described in this part, nothing in this part shall affect the nonprofit or tax exempt status of any nonprofit charitable, religious, or educational health care provider under any:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-502(1)(a): state law;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-502(1)(b): ad valorem property taxes;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-502(1)(c): sales or use taxes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-502(1)(d): other taxes, fees, or assessments, whether imposed or sought to be imposed, by the state or any political subdivision of the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-502(2): All assessments paid under this part may be included as an allowable cost of a hospital for purposes of any applicable Medicaid reimbursement formula.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-502(3): This part does not authorize a political subdivision of the state to:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-502(3)(a): license a hospital for revenue;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-502(3)(b): impose a tax or assessment upon a hospital; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-502(3)(c): impose a tax or assessment measured by the income or earnings of a hospital.

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-508(3)(b)(i): 26B-3-506 1% of the portion of the hospital share specified in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-508(3)(b)(ii): 26B-3-506 0% of the hospital share specified in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-508(4): The department shall, by rule made in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, designate:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-508(4)(a): the method of calculating the amounts designated in Subsection (3); and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-508(4)(b): the schedule for the intergovernmental transfers.


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-509 Penalties and interest.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-509(1): A hospital that fails to pay a quarterly assessment, make the mandated intergovernmental transfer, or file a return as required under this part, within the time required by this part, shall pay penalties described in this section, in addition to the assessment or intergovernmental transfer.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-509(2): (2)(a) If a hospital fails to timely pay the full amount of a quarterly assessment or the mandated intergovernmental transfer, the department shall add to the assessment or intergovernmental transfer:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-509(2)(a): a penalty equal to 5% of the quarterly amount not paid on or before the due date; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-509(2)(b): (2)(a) on the last day of each quarter after the due date until the assessed amount and the penalty imposed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-509(2)(b)(i): any unpaid quarterly assessment or intergovernmental transfer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-509(2)(b)(ii): any unpaid penalty assessment.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-509(3): Upon making a record of the division's actions, and upon reasonable cause shown, the division may waive, reduce, or compromise any of the penalties imposed under this part.


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-510 Hospital reimbursement.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-510(1): If the health coverage improvement program, the enhancement waiver program, or the Medicaid waiver expansion is implemented by contracting with a Medicaid accountable care organization, the department shall, to the extent allowed by law, include, in a contract to provide benefits under the health coverage improvement program, the enhancement waiver program, or the Medicaid waiver expansion, a requirement that the Medicaid accountable care organization reimburse hospitals in the accountable care organization's provider network at no less than the Medicaid fee-for-service rate.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-510(2): If the health coverage improvement program, the enhancement waiver program, or the Medicaid waiver expansion is implemented by the department as a fee-for-service program, the department shall reimburse hospitals at no less than the Medicaid fee-for-service rate.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-510(3): Nothing in this section prohibits a Medicaid accountable care organization from paying a rate that exceeds the Medicaid fee-for-service rate.


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-511 Outpatient upper payment limit supplemental payments.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-511(1): The department shall administer an outpatient upper payment limit program for private hospitals that supplements the reimbursement to private hospitals in accordance with Subsection (2).
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-511(2): The division shall ensure that supplemental payment to Utah private hospitals under Subsection (1):
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-511(2)(a): does not exceed the positive upper payment limit gap; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-511(2)(b): is allocated based on the Medicaid state plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-511(3): The department shall use the same outpatient data to allocate the payments under Subsection (2) and to calculate the upper payment limit gap.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-511(4): The supplemental payments to private hospitals under Subsection (1) are payable for outpatient hospital services provided on or after the later of:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-511(4)(a): July 1, 2016;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-511(4)(b): the effective date of the Medicaid state plan amendment necessary to implement the payments under this section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-511(4)(c): the effective date of the coverage provided through the health coverage improvement program waiver.


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-512 Repeal of assessment.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-512(1): 63I-1-226 The assessment imposed by this part shall be repealed when:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-512(1)(a): the executive director certifies that:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-512(1)(a)(i): action by Congress is in effect that disqualifies the assessment imposed by this part from counting toward state Medicaid funds available to be used to determine the amount of federal financial participation;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-512(1)(a)(ii): a decision, enactment, or other determination by the Legislature or by any court, officer, department, or agency of the state, or of the federal government, is in effect that:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-512(1)(a)(ii)(A): disqualifies the assessment from counting toward state Medicaid funds available to be used to determine federal financial participation for Medicaid matching funds; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-512(1)(a)(ii)(B): creates for any reason a failure of the state to use the assessments for at least one of the Medicaid programs described in this part; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-512(1)(a)(iii): a change is in effect that reduces the aggregate hospital inpatient and outpatient payment rate below the aggregate hospital inpatient and outpatient payment rate for July 1, 2015; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-512(1)(b): 63I-1-226 this part is repealed in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-512(2): 26B-1-315 If the assessment is repealed under Subsection (1):
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-512(2)(a): the division may not collect any assessment or intergovernmental transfer under this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-512(2)(b): 26B-1-315 the department shall disburse money in the Medicaid ACA Fund in accordance with the requirements in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-512(2)(c): any money remaining in the Medicaid ACA Fund after the disbursement described in Subsection (2)(b) that was derived from assessments imposed by this part shall be refunded to the hospitals in proportion to the amount paid by each hospital for the last three fiscal years; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-512(2)(d): any money remaining in the Medicaid ACA Fund after the disbursements described in Subsections (2)(b) and (c) shall be deposited into the General Fund by the end of the fiscal year that the assessment is suspended.


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(1): "Assessment" means the Medicaid expansion hospital assessment established by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(2): "CMS" means the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services within the United States Department of Health and Human Services.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(3): "Discharges" means the number of total hospital discharges reported on:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(3)(a): Worksheet S-3 Part I, column 15, lines 14, 16, and 17 of the 2552-10 Medicare cost report for the applicable assessment year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(3)(b): a similar report adopted by the department by administrative rule, if the report under Subsection (3)(a) is no longer available.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(4): "Division" means the Division of Integrated Healthcare within the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(5): 26B-3-605 "Hospital share" means the hospital share described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(6): 26B-3-202 "Medicaid accountable care organization" means a managed care organization, as defined in 42 C.F.R. Sec. 438, that contracts with the department under the provisions of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(7): 26B-1-315 "Medicaid ACA Fund" means the Medicaid ACA Fund created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(8): 26B-3-210 "Medicaid waiver expansion" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(9): "Medicare cost report" means CMS-2552-10, the cost report for electronic filing of hospitals.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(10): 
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(10)(a): "Non-state government hospital" means a hospital owned by a non-state government entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(10)(b): "Non-state government hospital" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(10)(b)(i): the Utah State Hospital; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(10)(b)(ii): a hospital owned by the federal government, including the Veterans Administration Hospital.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(11): 26B-2-201; 26B-2-101
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(11)(a): 26B-2-201 "Private hospital" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(11)(a)(i): 26B-2-201 a privately owned general acute hospital operating in the state as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(11)(a)(ii): a privately owned specialty hospital operating in the state, including a privately owned hospital for which inpatient admissions are predominantly:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(11)(a)(ii)(A): rehabilitation;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(11)(a)(ii)(B): psychiatric;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(11)(a)(ii)(C): chemical dependency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(11)(a)(ii)(D): long-term acute care services.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(11)(b): 26B-2-101 "Private hospital" does not include a facility for residential treatment as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(12): 26B-3-113 "Qualified Medicaid expansion" means an expansion of the Medicaid program in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-601(13): "State teaching hospital" means a state owned teaching hospital that is part of an institution of higher education.


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-602 Application.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-602(1): Other than for the imposition of the assessment described in this part, nothing in this part shall affect the nonprofit or tax exempt status of any nonprofit charitable, religious, or educational health care provider under any:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-602(1)(a): state law;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-602(1)(b): ad valorem property tax requirement;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-602(1)(c): sales or use tax requirement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-602(1)(d): other requirements imposed by taxes, fees, or assessments, whether imposed or sought to be imposed, by the state or any political subdivision of the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-602(2): A hospital paying an assessment under this part may include the assessment as an allowable cost of a hospital for purposes of any applicable Medicaid reimbursement formula.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-602(3): This part does not authorize a political subdivision of the state to:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-602(3)(a): license a hospital for revenue;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-602(3)(b): impose a tax or assessment upon a hospital; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-602(3)(c): impose a tax or assessment measured by the income or earnings of a hospital.

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-604 Collection of assessment -- Deposit of revenue -- Rulemaking.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-604(1): 26B-3-603 The department shall act as the collecting agent for the assessment imposed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-604(2): The department shall administer and enforce the provisions of this part, and may make rules, in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, necessary to:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-604(2)(a): collect the assessment, intergovernmental transfers, and penalties imposed under this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-604(2)(b): audit records of a facility that:

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-604(2)(b)(ii): does not file a Medicare cost report; and

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-604(4):

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-604(4)(b): The department may make rules creating requirements to allow the time for paying the assessment to be extended.


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-605 Hospital share.
-----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-605(1): The hospital share is 100% of the state's net cost of Medicaid expansion, after deducting appropriate offsets and savings as a result of implementing Medicaid expansion, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-605(1)(a): savings from:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-605(1)(a)(i): the Medicaid program's former Primary Care Network program;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-605(1)(a)(ii): the health coverage improvement program;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-605(1)(a)(iii): the state portion of inpatient prison medical coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-605(1)(a)(iv): behavioral health coverage; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-605(1)(a)(v): county contributions to the non-federal share of Medicaid expenditures; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-605(1)(b): any funds appropriated to the Medicaid ACA Fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-605(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-605(2)(a): The hospital share is capped at no more than $15,000,000 annually.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-605(2)(b): The division shall prorate the cap specified in Subsection (2)(a) in any year in which Medicaid expansion is not in effect for the full fiscal year.


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-606 Hospital financing.
---------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-606(1): 26B-3-611 Private hospitals shall be assessed under this part for the portion of the hospital share described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-606(2): 26B-3-113(8) In the report described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-606(3): If the assessment collected in the previous fiscal year is above or below the hospital share for private hospitals for the previous fiscal year, the division shall apply the underpayment or overpayment of the assessment by the private hospitals to the fiscal year in which the report is issued.


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607 Calculation of assessment.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(1): 26B-3-606
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(1)(a): Except as provided in Subsection (1)(b), each private hospital shall pay an annual assessment due on the last day of each quarter in an amount calculated by the division at a uniform assessment rate for each hospital discharge, in accordance with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(1)(b): A private teaching hospital with more than 425 beds and more than 60 residents shall pay an assessment rate 2.5 times the uniform rate established under Subsection (1)(c).
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(1)(c): 26B-3-606 The division shall calculate the uniform assessment rate described in Subsection (1)(a) by dividing the hospital share for assessed private hospitals, as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(1)(c)(i): the total number of discharges for assessed private hospitals that are not a private teaching hospital; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(1)(c)(ii): 2.5 times the number of discharges for a private teaching hospital, described in Subsection (1)(b).
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(1)(d): The division may make rules in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, to adjust the formula described in Subsection (1)(c) to address unforeseen circumstances in the administration of the assessment under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(1)(e): The division shall apply any quarterly changes to the uniform assessment rate uniformly to all assessed private hospitals.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(2): Except as provided in Subsection (3), for each state fiscal year, the division shall determine a hospital's discharges as the hospital's cost report data for the hospital's fiscal year that ended in the state fiscal year two years before the assessment fiscal year.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(3)(a): If a hospital's fiscal year Medicare cost report is not contained in the CMS Healthcare Cost Report Information System file:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(3)(a)(i): the hospital shall submit to the division a copy of the hospital's Medicare cost report applicable to the assessment year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(3)(a)(ii): the division shall determine the hospital's discharges.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(3)(b): If a hospital is not certified by the Medicare program and is not required to file a Medicare cost report:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(3)(b)(i): the hospital shall submit to the division the hospital's applicable fiscal year discharges with supporting documentation;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(3)(b)(ii): the division shall determine the hospital's discharges from the information submitted under Subsection (3)(b)(i); and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(3)(b)(iii): if the hospital fails to submit discharge information, the division shall audit the hospital's records and may impose a penalty equal to 5% of the calculated assessment.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(4): Except as provided in Subsection (5), if a hospital is owned by an organization that owns more than one hospital in the state:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(4)(a): the division shall calculate the assessment for each hospital separately; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(4)(b): each separate hospital shall pay the assessment imposed by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(5): If multiple hospitals use the same Medicaid provider number:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(5)(a): the department shall calculate the assessment in the aggregate for the hospitals using the same Medicaid provider number; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-607(5)(b): the hospitals may pay the assessment in the aggregate.


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-608 State teaching hospital and non-state government hospital mandatory intergovernmental transfer.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-608(1): A state teaching hospital and a non-state government hospital shall make an intergovernmental transfer to the Medicaid ACA Fund, in accordance with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-608(2): The hospitals described in Subsection (1) shall pay the intergovernmental transfer beginning on the later of:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-608(2)(a): April 1, 2019; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-608(2)(b): CMS approval of the assessment for private hospitals in this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-608(3): 26B-3-611; 26B-3-611 The intergovernmental transfer is apportioned between the non-state government hospitals as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-608(3)(a): 26B-3-611 the state teaching hospital shall pay for the portion of the hospital share described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-608(3)(b): 26B-3-611 non-state government hospitals shall pay for the portion of the hospital share described in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-610 Hospital reimbursement.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-610(1): To the extent allowed by law, the department shall in any contract with a Medicaid accountable care organization to implement Medicaid expansion include a requirement that the Medicaid accountable care organization reimburse hospitals in the Medicaid accountable care organization's provider network at no less than the Medicaid fee-for-service rate.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-610(2): Where the department implements Medicaid expansion as a fee-for-service program, the department shall reimburse hospitals at no less than the Medicaid fee-for-service rate.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-610(3): Nothing in this section prohibits the department or a Medicaid accountable care organization from paying a rate that exceeds the Medicaid fee-for-service rate.

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-612 Suspension of assessment.
---------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-612(1)(b): a decision, enactment, or other determination by the Legislature or by any court, officer, department, or agency of the state, or of the federal government, is in effect that:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-612(1)(b)(i): disqualifies the assessment from counting toward state Medicaid funds available to be used to determine federal financial participation for Medicaid matching funds; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-612(1)(b)(ii): creates for any reason a failure of the state to use the assessments for at least one of the Medicaid programs described in this part; or

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-701 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-701(1): 26B-3-202 "Accountable care organization" means a managed care organization, as defined in 42 C.F.R. Sec. 438, that contracts with the department under the provisions of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-701(2): "Assessment" means the Medicaid hospital provider assessment established by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-701(3): "Discharges" means the number of total hospital discharges reported on Worksheet S-3 Part I, column 15, lines 12, 14, and 14.01 of the 2552-96 Medicare Cost Report or on Worksheet S-3 Part I, column 15, lines 14, 16, and 17 of the 2552-10 Medicare Cost Report for the applicable assessment year.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-701(4): "Division" means the Division of Integrated Healthcare of the department.

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-701(5)(a): 26B-2-201 means a privately owned:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-701(5)(a)(i): 26B-2-201 general acute hospital operating in the state as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-701(5)(a)(ii): specialty hospital operating in the state, which shall include a privately owned hospital whose inpatient admissions are predominantly:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-701(5)(a)(ii)(A): rehabilitation;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-701(5)(a)(ii)(B): psychiatric;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-701(5)(a)(ii)(C): chemical dependency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-701(5)(a)(ii)(D): long-term acute care services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-701(5)(b): 26B-2-101 does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-701(5)(b)(i): 26B-2-101 a human services program, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-701(5)(b)(ii): a hospital owned by the federal government, including the Veterans Administration Hospital; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-701(5)(b)(iii): a hospital that is owned by the state government, a state agency, or a political subdivision of the state, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-701(5)(b)(iii)(A): a state-owned teaching hospital; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-701(5)(b)(iii)(B): the Utah State Hospital.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-701(6): "Medicare Cost Report" means CMS-2552-96 or CMS-2552-10, the cost report for electronic filing of hospitals.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-701(7): "State plan amendment" means a change or update to the state Medicaid plan.


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-702 Legislative findings.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-702(1): The Legislature finds that there is an important state purpose to improve the access of Medicaid patients to quality care in Utah hospitals because of continuous decreases in state revenues and increases in enrollment under the Utah Medicaid program.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-702(2): (1) The Legislature finds that in order to improve this access to those persons described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-702(2)(a): the rates paid to Utah hospitals shall be adequate to encourage and support improved access; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-702(2)(b): adequate funding shall be provided to increase the rates paid to Utah hospitals providing services pursuant to the Utah Medicaid program.


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-703 Application of part.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-703(1): Other than for the imposition of the assessment described in this part, nothing in this part shall affect the nonprofit or tax exempt status of any nonprofit charitable, religious, or educational health care provider under:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-703(1)(a): Section 501(c), as amended, of the Internal Revenue Code;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-703(1)(b): other applicable federal law;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-703(1)(c): any state law;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-703(1)(d): any ad valorem property taxes;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-703(1)(e): any sales or use taxes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-703(1)(f): any other taxes, fees, or assessments, whether imposed or sought to be imposed by the state or any political subdivision, county, municipality, district, authority, or any agency or department thereof.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-703(2): All assessments paid under this part may be included as an allowable cost of a hospital for purposes of any applicable Medicaid reimbursement formula.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-703(3): This part does not authorize a political subdivision of the state to:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-703(3)(a): license a hospital for revenue;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-703(3)(b): impose a tax or assessment upon hospitals; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-703(3)(c): impose a tax or assessment measured by the income or earnings of a hospital.

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705 Calculation of assessment.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705(1): 26B-3-707
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705(1)(a): An annual assessment is payable on a quarterly basis for each hospital in an amount calculated at a uniform assessment rate for each hospital discharge, in accordance with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705(1)(b): 26B-3-707 The uniform assessment rate shall be determined using the total number of hospital discharges for assessed hospitals divided into the total non-federal portion in an amount consistent with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705(1)(c): Any quarterly changes to the uniform assessment rate shall be applied uniformly to all assessed hospitals.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705(1)(d): The annual uniform assessment rate may not generate more than:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705(1)(d)(i): $1,000,000 to offset Medicaid mandatory expenditures; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705(1)(d)(ii): the non-federal share to seed amounts needed to support capitated rates for Medicaid accountable care organizations as provided for in Subsection (1)(b).
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705(2)(a): For each state fiscal year, discharges shall be determined using the data from each hospital's Medicare Cost Report contained in the CMS Healthcare Cost Report Information System file. The hospital's discharge data is the hospital's cost report data for the hospital's fiscal year that ended in the state fiscal year two years prior to the assessment fiscal year.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705(2)(b): If a hospital's fiscal year Medicare Cost Report is not contained in the CMS Healthcare Cost Report Information System file:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705(2)(b)(i): the hospital shall submit to the division a copy of the hospital's Medicare Cost Report applicable to the assessment year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705(2)(b)(ii): the division shall determine the hospital's discharges.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705(2)(c): If a hospital is not certified by the Medicare program and is not required to file a Medicare Cost Report:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705(2)(c)(i): the hospital shall submit to the division its applicable fiscal year discharges with supporting documentation;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705(2)(c)(ii): the division shall determine the hospital's discharges from the information submitted under Subsection (2)(c)(i); and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705(2)(c)(iii): the failure to submit discharge information shall result in an audit of the hospital's records and a penalty equal to 5% of the calculated assessment.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705(3): Except as provided in Subsection (4), if a hospital is owned by an organization that owns more than one hospital in the state:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705(3)(a): the assessment for each hospital shall be separately calculated by the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705(3)(b): each separate hospital shall pay the assessment imposed by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705(4): Notwithstanding the requirement of Subsection (3), if multiple hospitals use the same Medicaid provider number:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705(4)(a): the department shall calculate the assessment in the aggregate for the hospitals using the same Medicaid provider number; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-705(4)(b): the hospitals may pay the assessment in the aggregate.


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-706 Quarterly notice -- Collection.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Quarterly assessments imposed by this part shall be paid to the division within 15 business days after the original invoice date that appears on the invoice issued by the division.

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-707 Medicaid hospital adjustment under Medicaid accountable care organization rates.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-707(1): To preserve and improve access to hospital services, the division shall incorporate into the Medicaid accountable care organization rate structure calculation consistent with the certified actuarial rate range:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-707(1)(a): $154,000,000 to be allocated toward the hospital inpatient directed payments for the Medicaid eligibility categories covered in Utah before January 1, 2019; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-707(1)(b): an amount equal to the difference between payments made to hospitals by Medicaid accountable care organizations for the Medicaid eligibility categories covered in Utah, based on submitted encounter data, and the maximum amount that could be paid for those services, to be used for directed payments to hospitals for inpatient and outpatient services.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-707(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-707(2)(a): To preserve and improve the quality of inpatient and outpatient hospital services authorized under Subsection (1)(b), the division shall amend its quality strategies required by 42 C.F.R. Sec. 438.340 to include quality measures selected from the CMS hospital quality improvement programs.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-707(2)(b): To better address the unique needs of rural and specialty hospitals, the division may adopt different quality standards for rural and specialty hospitals.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-707(2)(c): The division shall make rules in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, to adopt the selected quality measures and prescribe penalties for not meeting the quality standards that are established by the division by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-707(2)(d): The division shall apply the same quality measures and penalties under this Subsection (2) to new directed payments made to the University of Utah Hospital and Clinics.

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-803 Calculation of assessment.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-803(1): The division shall calculate a uniform assessment per transport as described in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-803(2): The assessment due from a given ambulance service provider equals the non-federal portion divided by total transports, multiplied by the number of transports for the ambulance service provider.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-803(3): The division shall apply any quarterly changes to the assessment rate, calculated as described in Subsection (2), uniformly to all assessed ambulance service providers.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-803(4): The assessment may not generate more than the total of:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-803(4)(a): an annual amount of $20,000 to offset Medicaid administration expenses; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-803(4)(b): the non-federal portion.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-803(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-803(5)(a): For each state fiscal year, the division shall calculate total transports using ambulance service provider transports data from the Emergency Medical System for the calendar year ending 18 months before the end of the fiscal year.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-803(5)(b): If an ambulance service provider fails to submit transport information to the Emergency Medical System, the division may audit the ambulance service provider to determine the ambulance service provider's transports for a given fiscal year.


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-804 Medicaid ambulance service provider adjustment under fee-for-service rates.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The division shall, if the assessment imposed by this part is approved by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, for fee-for-service rates effective on or after July 1, 2015, reimburse an ambulance service provider in an amount up to the Emergency Medical Services Ambulance Rates adopted annually by the department.

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-901 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-901(1): "Child" means an individual who is younger than 19 years old.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-901(2): "Member" means a child enrolled in the program.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-901(3): "Plan" means the department's plan submitted to the United States Department of Health and Human Services pursuant to 42 U.S.C. Sec. 1397ff.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-901(4): "Program" means the Utah Children's Health Insurance Program created by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-901(5): "Traditionally eligible child" means, subject to limitations created by the federal government, a child who is:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-901(5)(a): a citizen of the United States;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-901(5)(b): a qualified non-citizen;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-901(5)(c): a Supplemental Security Income recipient living in the United States on August 22, 1996, that meets the federal government's criteria for one of the grand-fathered Supplemental Security Income recipient non-citizen groups; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-901(5)(d): a lawfully present child.

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-903 Eligibility.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-903(1): A traditionally eligible child may enroll in the program if the child:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-903(1)(a): is a bona fide Utah resident;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-903(1)(b): does not have access to or coverage under other health insurance, including any coverage available through a parent or legal guardian's employer;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-903(1)(c): is ineligible for Medicaid benefits;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-903(1)(d): resides in a household whose gross family income, as defined by rule, is at or below 200% of the federal poverty level; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-903(1)(e): is not an inmate of a public institution or a patient in an institution for mental diseases.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-903(2): (1) A child who qualifies for enrollment in the program under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-903(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-903(3)(a): The department shall determine eligibility and send notification of the eligibility decision within 30 days after receiving the application for coverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-903(3)(b): If the department cannot reach a decision because the applicant fails to take a required action, or because there is an administrative or other emergency beyond the department's control, the department shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-903(3)(b)(i): document the reason for the delay in the applicant's case record; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-903(3)(b)(ii): inform the applicant of the status of the application and time frame for completion.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-903(4): (1) The department may not close enrollment in the program for a child who is eligible to enroll in the program under the provisions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-903(5): (5)(b) The program shall:

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-905 Limitation of benefits.
-------------------------------------------------------
Abortion is not a covered benefit, except as provided in 42 U.S.C. Sec. 1397ee.

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-906 Funding.
----------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-906(1): The program shall be funded by federal matching funds received under, together with state matching funds required by, 42 U.S.C. Sec. 1397ee.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-906(2): Program expenditures in the following categories may not exceed 10% in the aggregate of all federal payments pursuant to 42 U.S.C. Sec. 1397ee:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-906(2)(a): other forms of child health assistance for children with gross family incomes below 200% of the federal poverty level;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-906(2)(b): other health services initiatives to improve low-income children's health;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-906(2)(c): outreach program expenditures; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-906(2)(d): administrative costs.


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-907 Evaluation.
-------------------------------------------
The department shall develop performance measures and annually evaluate the program's performance.

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-908 Managed care -- Contracting for services.

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(1): 31A-1-301 "Annuity" shall have the same meaning as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(2): "Care facility" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(2)(a): a nursing facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(2)(b): an intermediate care facility for an individual with an intellectual disability; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(2)(c): any other medical institution.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(3): "Claim" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(3)(a): a request or demand for payment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(3)(b): a cause of action for money or damages arising under any law.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(4): "Employee welfare benefit plan" means a medical insurance plan developed by an employer under 29 U.S.C. Sec. 1001, et seq., the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 as amended.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(5): 31A-1-301 "Health insurance entity" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(5)(a): an insurer;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(5)(b): 31A-1-301 a person who administers, manages, provides, offers, sells, carries, or underwrites health insurance, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(5)(c): a self-insured plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(5)(d): a group health plan, as defined in Subsection 607(1) of the federal Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(5)(e): a service benefit plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(5)(f): a managed care organization;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(5)(g): a pharmacy benefit manager;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(5)(h): an employee welfare benefit plan; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(5)(i): a person who is, by statute, contract, or agreement, legally responsible for payment of a claim for a health care item or service.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(6): "Inpatient" means an individual who is a patient and a resident of a care facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(7): "Insurer" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(7)(a): a group health plan as defined in Subsection 607(1) of the federal Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(7)(b): a health maintenance organization; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(7)(c): any entity offering a health service benefit plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(8): "Medical assistance" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(8)(a): all funds expended for the benefit of a recipient under this chapter or Titles XVIII and XIX, federal Social Security Act; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(8)(b): any other services provided for the benefit of a recipient by a prepaid health care delivery system under contract with the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(9): "Office of Recovery Services" means the Office of Recovery Services within the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(10): "Provider" means a person or entity who provides services to a recipient.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(11): (11)(a); (11)(a) "Recipient" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(11)(a): an individual who has applied for or received medical assistance from the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(11)(b): (11)(a) the guardian, conservator, or other personal representative of an individual under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(11)(c): (11)(a) the estate and survivors of an individual under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(12)(a): 75-1-201 all real and personal property or other assets included within a decedent's estate as defined in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(13): "State plan" means the state Medicaid program as enacted in accordance with Title XIX, federal Social Security Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1001(14): "TEFRA lien" means a lien, authorized under the Tax Equity and Fiscal Responsibility Act of 1982, against the real property of an individual prior to the individual's death, as described in 42 U.S.C. Sec. 1396p.

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1004 Health insurance entity -- Duties related to state claims for Medicaid payment or recovery.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1004(1): As a condition of doing business in the state, a health insurance entity shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1004(1)(a): with respect to an individual who is eligible for, or is provided, medical assistance under the state plan, upon the request of the department, provide information to determine:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1004(1)(a)(i): during what period the individual, or the spouse or dependent of the individual, may be or may have been, covered by the health insurance entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1004(1)(a)(ii): the nature of the coverage that is or was provided by the health insurance entity described in Subsection (1)(a), including the name, address, and identifying number of the plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1004(1)(b): accept the state's right of recovery and the assignment to the state of any right of an individual to payment from a party for an item or service for which payment has been made under the state plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1004(1)(c): respond within 60 days to any inquiry by the department regarding a claim for payment for any health care item or service that is submitted no later than three years after the day on which the health care item or service is provided;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1004(1)(d): not deny a claim submitted by the department solely on the basis of the date of submission of the claim, the type or format of the claim form, or failure to present proper documentation at the point-of-sale that is the basis for the claim, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1004(1)(d)(i): the claim is submitted no later than three years after the day on which the item or service is furnished; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1004(1)(d)(ii): any action by the department to enforce the rights of the state with respect to the claim is commenced no later than six years after the day on which the claim is submitted; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1004(1)(e): not deny a claim submitted by the department or the department's contractor for an item or service solely on the basis that such item or service did not receive prior authorization under the third-party payer's rules.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1004(2): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the department shall make rules that:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1004(2)(a): construe and implement Subsection (1)(e); and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1004(2)(b): encourage health care providers to seek prior authorization when necessary from a health insurance entity that is the primary payer before seeking third-party liability through Medicaid.


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1005 Insurance policies not to deny or reduce benefits of individuals eligible for state medical assistance -- Exemptions.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1005(1): A policy of accident or sickness insurance may not contain any provision denying or reducing benefits because services are rendered to an insured or dependent who is eligible for or receiving medical assistance from the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1005(2): An association, corporation, or organization may not deliver, issue for delivery, or renew any subscriber's contract which contains any provisions denying or reducing benefits because services are rendered to a subscriber or dependent who is eligible for or receiving medical assistance from the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1005(3): An association, corporation, business, or organization authorized to do business in this state and which provides or pays for any health care benefits may not deny or reduce benefits because services are rendered to a beneficiary who is eligible for or receiving medical assistance from the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1005(4): (1); (2); (3) Notwithstanding Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1006 Availability of insurance policy.
------------------------------------------------------------------
If the third party does not pay the department's claim or lien within 30 days from the date the claim or lien is received, the third party shall:Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1006(1): provide a written explanation if the claim is denied;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1006(2): specifically describe and request any additional information from the department that is necessary to process the claim; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1006(3): provide the department or its agent a copy of any relevant or applicable insurance or benefit policy.


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1007 Employee benefit plans.
--------------------------------------------------------
As allowed pursuant to 29 U.S.C. Sec. 1144, an employee benefit plan may not include any provision that has the effect of limiting or excluding coverage or payment for any health care for an individual who would otherwise be covered or entitled to benefits or services under the terms of the employee benefit plan based on the fact that the individual is eligible for or is provided services under the state plan.

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1016 Presumption of permanency.
-----------------------------------------------------------
There is a rebuttable presumption that an individual who is an inpatient in a care facility cannot reasonably be expected to be discharged from a care facility and return to the individual's home, if the individual has been an inpatient in a care facility for a period of at least 180 consecutive days.

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-3-1022 Contract with another government agency.
