Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-402 Application of this part only to Non IV-D cases.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The requirements of this part apply only to cases in which neither the obligee nor the obligor is receiving IV-D services.

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403 Child support orders issued or modified on or after January 1, 1994 -- Immediate income withholding.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(1): With regard to obligees or obligors who are not receiving IV-D services, each child support order issued or modified on or after January 1, 1994, subjects the income of an obligor to immediate income withholding as of the effective date of the order, regardless of whether a delinquency occurs unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(1)(a): the court or administrative body that entered the order finds that one of the parties has demonstrated good cause so as not to require immediate income withholding; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(1)(b): a written agreement which provides an alternative payment arrangement is executed by the obligor and obligee, and reviewed and entered in the record by the court or administrative body.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(2): For purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(2)(a): an action on or after January 1, 1994, to reduce child support arrears to judgment, without a corresponding establishment of or modification to a base child support amount, is not sufficient to trigger immediate income withholding;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(2)(b): good cause shall be based on, at a minimum:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(2)(b)(i): a determination and explanation on the record by the court or administrative body that implementation of income withholding would not be in the best interest of the child; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(2)(b)(ii): proof of timely payment of any previously ordered support; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(2)(c): in determining good cause, the court or administrative body may, in addition to any other requirement it considers appropriate, consider whether the obligor has:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(2)(c)(i): obtained a bond, deposited money in trust for the benefit of the children, or otherwise made arrangements sufficient to guarantee child support payments for at least two months;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(2)(c)(ii): arranged to deposit all child support payments into a checking account belonging to the obligee, or made arrangements insuring that a reliable and independent record of the date and place of child support payments will be maintained; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(2)(c)(iii): arranged for electronic transfer of funds on a regular basis to meet court-ordered child support obligations.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(3): In cases where the court or administrative body that entered the order finds a demonstration of good cause or enters a written agreement that immediate income withholding is not required, in accordance with this section, any party may subsequently pursue income withholding on the earliest of the following dates:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(3)(a): the date payment of child support becomes delinquent;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(3)(b): the date the obligor requests;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(3)(c): the date the obligee requests if a written agreement under Subsection (1)(b) exists; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(3)(d): the date the court or administrative body so modifies that order.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(4): The court shall include in every child support order issued or modified on or after January 1, 1994, a provision that the income of an obligor is subject to income withholding in accordance with this chapter; however, if for any reason that provision is not included in the child support order, the obligor's income is nevertheless subject to income withholding.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(5): 26B-9-407; 26B-9-405; 26B-9-408
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(5)(a): 26B-9-407 In any action to establish or modify a child support order after July 1, 1997, the court, upon request by the obligee or obligor, shall commence immediate income withholding by ordering the clerk of the court or the requesting party to:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(5)(a)(i): 26B-9-407 mail written notice to the payor at the payor's last-known address that contains the information required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(5)(a)(ii): mail a copy of the written notice sent to the payor under Subsection (5)(a)(i) and a copy of the support order to the office.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(5)(b): 26B-9-405 If neither the obligee nor obligor requests commencement of income withholding under Subsection (5)(a), the court shall include in the order to establish or modify child support a provision that the obligor or obligee may commence income withholding by:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(5)(b)(i): applying for IV-D services with the office; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-403(5)(b)(ii): 26B-9-405 filing an ex parte motion with a district court of competent jurisdiction pursuant to Section

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-406 Responsibilities of the office.
---------------------------------------------------------------
The office shall document and distribute payments in the manner provided for and in the time required by SectionUtah Code Annotated § 26B-9-406(1): 26B-9-403; 26B-9-405 a copy of the written notice sent to the payor under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-406(2): the order of support;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-406(3): the obligee's address; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-406(4): withheld income from the payor.


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-407 Notice to payor.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-407(1): (1)(c); 26B-9-217; 26B-9-403; 26B-9-405 A notice mailed or delivered to a payor under this part shall state in writing:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-407(1)(a): the amount of child support to be withheld from income;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-407(1)(b): that the child support must be withheld from the obligor's income each time the obligor is paid, but that the amount withheld may not exceed the maximum amount permitted under Section 303(b) of the Consumer Credit Protection Act, 15 U.S.C. Sec. 1673(b);
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-407(1)(c): that the payor must mail or deliver the withheld income to the office within seven business days of the date the amount would have been paid or credited to the employee but for this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-407(1)(d): that the payor may deduct from the obligor's income an additional amount which is equal to the amount payable to a garnishee under Rule 64D of the Utah Rules of Civil Procedure, as the payor's fee for administrative costs, but the total amount withheld may not exceed the maximum amount permitted under Section 303(b) of the Consumer Credit Protection Act, 15 U.S.C. Sec. 1673(b);
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-407(1)(e): that the notice to withhold is binding on the payor and on any future payor until further notice by the office or a court;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-407(1)(f): (1)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-407(1)(f)(i): (1)(c) that if the payor fails to mail or deliver withheld income to the office within the time period set in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-407(1)(f)(ii): that if the payor willfully fails to withhold income in accordance with the notice, the payor is liable to the obligee for $1,000 or the accumulated amount the payor should have withheld, whichever is greater, plus interest on that amount;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-407(1)(g): that the notice to withhold is prior to any other legal process under state law;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-407(1)(h): that the payor must begin to withhold income no later than the first time the obligor's earnings are normally paid after five working days from the date the payor receives the notice;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-407(1)(i): that the payor must notify the office within five days after the obligor terminates employment or the periodic income payment is terminated, and provide the obligor's last-known address and the name and address of any new payor, if known;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-407(1)(j): 26B-9-217 that if the payor discharges, refuses to employ, or takes disciplinary action against an obligor because of the notice to withhold, the payor is liable to the obligor as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-407(1)(k): 26B-9-403; 26B-9-405 that, in addition to any other remedy provided in this section, the payor is liable to the obligee or obligor for costs and reasonable attorney fees incurred in enforcing a provision in a notice to withhold mailed or delivered under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-407(2): If the obligor's employment with a payor is terminated, the office shall, if known and if contacted by the obligee, inform the obligee of:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-407(2)(a): the obligor's last-known address; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-407(2)(b): the name and address of any new payor.

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-409 Termination of income withholding.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-409(1): 26B-9-403; 26B-9-405
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-409(1)(a): 26B-9-403 At any time after the date income withholding begins, a party to the child support order may request a court to determine whether income withholding should be terminated due to:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-409(1)(a)(i): 26B-9-403 good cause under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-409(1)(a)(ii): the completion of an obligor's support obligation.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-409(1)(b): An obligor's payment of overdue child support may not be the sole basis for termination of income withholding.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-409(1)(c): 26B-9-405 After termination of income withholding under this section, a party may seek reinstatement of income withholding under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-409(2): (1)(a)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-409(2)(a): (1)(a)(i) If it is determined that income withholding should be terminated under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-409(2)(b): The obligee shall give written notice of termination to each payor:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-409(2)(b)(i): when the obligor no longer owes child support to the obligee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-409(2)(b)(ii): if the obligee and obligor enter into a written agreement that provides an alternative arrangement, which may be filed with the court.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-409(3): A notice to withhold income is binding on a payor until the court or the obligee notifies the payor that his obligation to withhold income has been terminated.


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-410 Payor's compliance with income withholding.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-410(1): Payment by a payor under this part satisfies the terms for payment of income under any contract between a payor and obligor.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-410(2): A payor who complies with an income withholding notice that is regular on its face may not be subject to civil liability to any person for conduct in compliance with the notice.


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-411 Violations by payor.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-411(1): A payor may not discharge, refuse to hire, or discipline any obligor because of a notice to withhold under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-411(2): (1); 26B-9-217 If a payor violates Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-412 Priority of notice or order to withhold income.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The notice to withhold under this part is prior to all other legal collection processes provided by state law, including garnishment, attachment, execution, and wage assignment.

Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-501 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-501(1): 26B-9-301 "Business day" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-501(2): 26B-9-101 "Child support" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-501(3): "Delinquent on a child support obligation" means that a person:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-501(3)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-501(3)(a)(i): made no payment for 60 days on a current child support obligation as set forth in an administrative or court order;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-501(3)(a)(ii): after the 60-day period described in Subsection (3)(a)(i), failed to make a good faith effort under the circumstances to make payment on the child support obligation in accordance with the order; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-501(3)(a)(iii): has not obtained a judicial order staying enforcement of the person's child support obligation, or the amount in arrears; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-501(3)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-501(3)(b)(i): made no payment for 60 days on an arrearage obligation of child support as set forth in:
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-501(3)(b)(i)(A): a payment schedule;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-501(3)(b)(i)(B): a written agreement with the office; or
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-501(3)(b)(i)(C): an administrative or judicial order;
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-501(3)(b)(ii): after the 60-day period described in Subsection (3)(b)(i), failed to make a good faith effort under the circumstances to make payment on the child support obligation in accordance with the payment schedule, agreement, or order; and
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-501(3)(b)(iii): has not obtained a judicial order staying enforcement of the person's child support obligation, or the amount in arrears.
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-501(4): 53-3-102 "Driver license" means a license, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-501(5): 53-3-103 "Driver License Division" means the Driver License Division of the Department of Public Safety created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 26B-9-501(6): "Office" means the Office of Recovery Services.
